member.name: M:VO.CEmail.StreamIn(System.String)
member.summary: This method gets called when an email messages is received. It calls into the Storage object to decode and store attachments.
member.param: The string that was received and needs to be decoded
member.remarks:
There is usually no need to call this method yourself. It gets called from the CPop class when receiving emails. It also gets called from the CEMail:Decode() message when decoding a raw message.
Visual Objects tries to avoid building large emails completely in memory. Therefore it reads or writes them in chunks. The StreamIn() and StreamOut() methods on the CEmail class handle these chunks.

member.name: M:VO.CEmail.StreamOut
member.summary: Generate message contents
member.remarks:
There is usually no need to call this message directly. It is called repeatedly from CSmtp:SendMail() when sending emails.
Visual Objects tries to avoid building large emails completely in memory. Therefore it reads or writes them in chunks. The StreamIn() and StreamOut() methods on the CEmail class handle these chunks.

member.name: M:VO.CEmail.StreamStart
member.summary: Initialize the Stream Status of an email message.
member.remarks:
There is usually no need to call this message directly. It is called repeatedly from CSmtp:SendMail() when sending emails, from CPop when receiving mails and from CEmail:Decode when decoding mails
Visual Objects tries to avoid building large emails completely in memory. Therefore it reads or writes them in chunks. The StreamIn() and StreamOut() methods on the CEmail class handle these chunks.

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.CloseFile(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Close a remote file.
member.param: Handle of a previously opened remote file.

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.CloseRemote
member.summary: Shut down the current Internet FTP connection.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method can be used to close the connection made for the CFtp object instance. If not specified, the connection will be automatically closed if the appropriate object instance goes out of scope.
member.example: See the CFtp:ConnectRemote() example.

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.ConnectRemote(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Connect an application to a remote FTP server.
member.param: String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
String that contains the name of the user to log on. If this parameter is NULL, the function uses the appropriate default ('anonymous'). For the FTP protocol, the default is anonymous.
User's password as a string. For anonymous login users, the user's e-mail name can be used as password.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method establishes a connection to a remote FTP server.
member.example:
The following example creates a list of all files and directories of the X# download section at ftp.cai.com:
FUNC ListVOFiles() LOCAL oFTP AS CFtp LOCAL lRet AS LOGIC LOCAL aRet AS ARRAY LOCAL i AS INT oFTP := CFtp{"VO Sample FTP Agent"} IF oFTP:ConnectRemote("ftp.cai.com", ; "anonymous", ; "Darth.Vader@starwars.com") oFTP:SetCurDir("/pub/vo") ? "Contents of Directory " + oFTP:GetCurDir() aRet := oFTP:Directory("*.*") FOR i := 1 UPTO ALen(aRet) ? aRet[i, F_NAME] ?? ", Size: " + NTrim(aRet[i, F_SIZE]) ?? ", Date/Time: " + DToC(aRet[i, F_DATE]) + ; "/" + aRet[i, F_TIME] ?? ", Attribute(s): ", aRet[i, F_ATTR] NEXT ENDIF oFTP:CloseRemote()
RETURN lRet

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.Directory(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)

The file name and extension can include the standard wildcard characters (* and ?). If you do not specify a drive and directory, the Windows defaults are used. If you do not specify any file name, '*.*' is assumed.
member.returns: An array of subarrays, with each subarray containing information about each file matching <cFileSpec>. The subarray elements are referenced as shown in the example under the CFtp:ConnectRemote() Method section.
member.remarks: This method returns information about files in the current or specified directory. You can use it to perform actions on groups of files.

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.GetCurDir

member.returns: Name of the current directory, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING.

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.GetFile(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Receive a file from the FTP server.
member.param: Name of the remote file that has to be received.
String that contains the name of the file to create on the local system. If not specified, <cRemoteFile> automatically becomes the name of the local file.
Logical value indicating whether the method should proceed if a local file of the specified name already exists. If <lFailIfExists> is TRUE and the local file exists, the GetFile() method fails.

Flags that control how the function will handle the file download. The first set of flag values indicates the conditions under which the transfer occurs. These transfer type flags can be used in combination with the second set of flags that control caching.
The application can select one of these transfer type values:
The following flags handle how the caching of this file will be handled. Any combination of the following flags can be used with the transfer type flag.
The possible values are:
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method retrieves a file from an FTP server and stores it under the specified name as a local file.
member.example:
The following receives the comprehensive list (00index.txt) of all files contained in the X# download section at ftp.cai.com:
FUNC TestGetFile() LOCAL oFTP AS CFtp LOCAL cFile AS STRING oFTP := CFtp{"VO Sample FTP Agent"} IF oFTP:ConnectRemote("ftp.cai.com", ; "anonymous", ; "Darth.Vader@starwars.com") cFile := "00index.txt" IF oFTP:SetCurDir("/pub/vo") IF oFTP:GetFile(cFile) IF File(cFile) ? "File received: " + FPathName() ENDIF ELSE __RaiseFTPError(oFTP) ENDIF ELSE __RaiseFTPError(oFTP) ENDIF ENDIF oFTP:CloseRemote() RETURN STATIC FUNC __RaiseFTPError (oFTP AS CFtp) AS INT ; PASCAL LOCAL cError AS STRING LOCAL nRet AS INT nRet := oFTP:Error IF nRet > 0 cError := oFTP:ErrorMsg IF SLen(cError) > 0 MessageBox(0, cError, "FTP Error", MB_OK) ENDIF ENDIF RETURN nRet

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.#ctor(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Construct a CFtp object instance.
member.param: Name of the application or entity calling subsequent methods. The default is 'VO Ftp Client'.
Port number. The default FTP port number is 21.
Logical value specifying whether the CFtp:InternetStatus() method should be called for status callback notifications. The default is TRUE.
Should an active connection be used. The default is FALSE which forces the cFtp class to run in passive mode.

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.InternetStatus(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Method InternetStatus() is a callback placeholder to receive current status information for an FTP session. It should be overloaded by subclasses to implement the desired behavior.
member.param: Application-defined context value associated with the current class.
Status code that indicates the reason for calling. It can be one of the following values:
Address of a buffer that contains information pertinent to this call to the callback function.
Size of the <pStatusInfo> buffer.
member.remarks: The InternetStatus() method can be used to receive different status information at any stage of an FTP transfer between the FTP client and server.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates using the InternetStatus() method to notify every status change to the owner window:
CLASS MyFTP INHERIT CFtp PROTECT oOwner AS OBJECT METHOD Init(oParent, cCaption, n, lStat)CLASS MyFtp SUPER:Init(cCaption, n, lStat) SELF:oOwner := oParent RETURN SELF METHOD InternetStatus( nContext, nStatus, ; pStatusInfo, nStatusLength ) CLASS MyFTP // // This method receives all Low Level FTP // notification. Please keep all parameters if you // want to overwrite it for your own purpose // LOCAL cMsg AS STRING DO CASE CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_RESOLVING_NAME cMsg := "Resolving Name ... " CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_NAME_RESOLVED cMsg := "Name resolved" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CONNECTING_TO_SERVER cMsg := "Connecting to Server ... " CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CONNECTED_TO_SERVER cMsg := "Connected to Server" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_SENDING_REQUEST cMsg := "Sending Request ... " CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_REQUEST_SENT cMsg := "Request sent" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_RECEIVING_RESPONSE cMsg := "Receiving response ..." CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_RESPONSE_RECEIVED cMsg := "Response received" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CTL_RESPONSE_RECEIVED cMsg := "CTL Response received" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_PREFETCH cMsg := "Prefetch" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CLOSING_CONNECTION cMsg := "Closing Connection ..." CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CONNECTION_CLOSED cMsg := "Connection closed" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_HANDLE_CREATED cMsg := "Handle created" // _DebOut32( "FTP Status : " + cMsg ) RETURN CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_HANDLE_CLOSING cMsg := "Closing handle ..." CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_REQUEST_COMPLETE cMsg := "Request complete" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_REDIRECT cMsg := "Redirect" OTHERWISE cMsg := "Unkown FTP Status" ENDCASE SELF:oOwner:FTPStatus := cMsg RETURN NIL

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.Open(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Initialize an application's use of the Win32 Internet functions.
member.param:
Flag that indicates various options affecting the behavior of the methods. It can be a combination of these values:
INTERNET_FLAG_OFFLINE
Satisfy download operations on this handle through the persistent cache only. If the item does not exist in the cache, the method returns an appropriate error code.
INTERNET_FLAG_ASYNC
Future operations on this handle may fail with ERROR_IO_PENDING.
String containing the name of the proxy server to use if proxy access was specified. If this parameter is NIL, the function reads proxy information from the registry.

Array with host names or IP addresses, or both, that are known locally. Requests to these names are not routed through the proxy. The strings can contain wildcards, such as {'157.55.*', '*int*'}, meaning any IP address starting with 157.55, or any name containing the substring 'int', will bypass the proxy.
If this array contains the '<local>' string as the only entry, the function bypasses any host name that does not contain a period. For example, 'www.cai.com' would be routed to the proxy, whereas 'internet' would not. If this parameter is NIL, the function reads the bypass list from the registry.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method initializes internal data structures and prepares for future calls to CFtp methods. It does not have to be called explicitly, because the CFtp:ConnectRemote() method internally calls this method, if necessary.

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.OpenFile(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Open a remote file for writing or reading.
member.param: String containing the name of the file that has to be accessed on the remote system.
Numeric value determining the type of file access (GENERIC_READ or GENERIC_WRITE — not both). The default is GENERIC_READ.

Conditions for operation with the specified file. The application should select one transfer type and any of the flags that control how the caching of the file will be controlled.
The transfer type can be any one of the following values:
The application can use one or more of the following values to control the caching of the file:
member.returns: File handle, if successful; otherwise, NULL_PTR.
member.remarks: The OpenFile() method initializes a remote file handle for subsequent file operations. The handle remains open until calling the CloseFile() method, and it can be used to call functions like InternetReadFile() or InternetWriteFile(), InternetCloseHandle(), or FtpFindFirstFile().

member.name: M:VO.CFtp.PutFile(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Store a file on the FTP server.
member.param: Name of the local file that is to be sent to the remote FTP server.
String that contains the name of the file to create on the remote FTP server. If not specified, <cLocalFile> automatically becomes the name of the remote file.
Logical value indicating whether the method should proceed if a remote file of the specified name already exists. If <lFailIfExists> is TRUE and the remote file exists, method PutFile() fails.

Flags that control how the function will handle the file upload and the conditions under which the transfers occur. The application should select one transfer type and any of the flags that control how the caching of the file will be controlled.
The transfer type can be any one of the following values:
The application can use one or more of the following values to control the caching of the file:
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method handles all of the necessary processes associated with reading a file locally and storing it on an FTP server.
member.example:
The following receives the comprehensive list (00index.txt) of all files contained in the X# download section at ftp.cai.com:
FUNC TestGetFile() LOCAL oFTP AS CFtp LOCAL cFile AS STRING oFTP := CFtp{"VO Sample FTP Agent"} IF oFTP:ConnectRemote("ftp.cai.com", ; "anonymous", ; "Darth.Vader@starwars.com") cFile := "00index.txt" IF oFTP:SetCurDir("/pub/vo") IF oFTP:GetFile(cFile) IF File(cFile) ? "File received: " + FPathName() ENDIF ELSE __RaiseFTPError(oFTP) ENDIF ELSE __RaiseFTPError(oFTP) ENDIF oFTP:CloseRemote() RETURN STATIC FUNC __RaiseFTPError (oFTP AS CFtp) AS INT ; PASCAL LOCAL cError AS STRING LOCAL nRet AS INT nRet := oFTP:Error IF nRet > 0 cError := oFTP:ErrorMsg IF SLen(cError) > 0 MessageBox(0, cError, "FTP Error", MB_OK) ENDIF ENDIF RETURN nRet

member.summary: Construct a check box.

The unique ID of the check box (between 1 and 8000).

The dimension of the check box in canvas coordinates.

member.name: M:VO.ChildAppWindow.Destroy
member.summary: Provide a method to free memory resources allocated for a ChildAppWindow object and its derived objects.
member.remarks: This method immediately frees resources for ChildAppWindow objects created explicitly in your application. ChildAppWindow:Destroy() also takes care of resources allocated to derived classes and deallocates them in the necessary order.

member.name: M:VO.ChildAppWindow.EnableOleDropTarget(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Register the window as an OLE drop target.
member.param: A logical value specifying whether to enable (TRUE) or disable (FALSE) the window as a drop target.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: A window that is registered as an OLE drop target using ChildAppWindow:EnableOLEDropTarget() can handle OLE drag and drop events and create new OLE objects in response to such events. In the associated handlers, an OLEDragEvent object is passed as a parameter that can be used to create a new OLE object by calling OLEObject:CreateFromOLEDragEvent().
member.example:
The following code enables a data window as a drop target and creates a new OLE object inside its OLEDrop handler. It also checks the name of the OLE object to allow only WordPad documents:
METHOD EnableOLEDropTarget CLASS DropTargetDataWindow SUPER:EnableOLEDropTarget(TRUE) METHOD OLEDrop(oOLEDragEvent) CLASS MyChild LOCAL oOLE AS OLEObject LOCAL lRet AS LOGIC IF oOLEDragEvent:ObjectName == "WordPad Document" oOLE := OLEObject{SELF} oOLE:AllowInPlace := TRUE oOLE:AllowResize := TRUE IF oOLE:CreateFromOLEDragEvent(oOLEDragEvent) oOLE:Origin := oOLEDragEvent:Position oOLE:Show() oOLE:SetFocus() ENDIF ENDIF

member.name: M:VO.ChildAppWindow.#ctor(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Construct a child application window.
member.param: The window that owns the child application window.

Indicates how to manage the child application window. If TRUE, the child window is managed by its owner as an MDI client. If FALSE (the default), the child window does not take its default style and menu from the MDI shell. In this case, you must explicitly provide code to control its behavior.

member.name: M:VO.Color.#ctor(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Construct a color using an RGB triplet.
member.param:
The amount of red, green, and blue (respectively) to be used to create the color. Each argument can be a value between 0 (lowest intensity) and 255 (highest intensity). The default value for each argument is 0.
If the first and second argument are both numeric and the second argument is -1, VO will treat the first number as the colorref of the color object.
Indicates the standard color to create, specified as one of the following constants:
member.remarks: Constant Color COLORBLACK Black COLORBLUE Blue COLORCYAN Cyan COLORGREEN Green COLORMAGENTA Magenta COLORRED Red COLORWHITE White COLORYELLOW Yellow

member.name: M:VO.ComboBoxEx.#ctor(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Instantiate a new ComboBoxEx object.
member.param: The window that owns the extended combo box.
The unique ID of the extended combo box (between 1 and 8000).
The origin of the extended combo box in canvas coordinates.
The dimension of the extended combo box in canvas coordinates.

The type of extended combo box to create, specified as one of the following constants:
Constant Creates
BOXDROPDOWN
An extended combo box with both an edit control and a drop-down icon beside it. The user can enter/edit text in the edit control, or choose items from the list box. (The list box appears only if the user selects the drop-down icon; if the user then selects the icon again, the list box is hidden.) This is the default.
BOXDROPDOWNLIST
Same as BOXDROPDOWN, except that the user can only choose items from the list box. Text cannot be entered or edited in the edit control.
BOXSIMPLE
A extended combo box with both an edit control and a list box that are visible at all times. The user can enter/edit text in the edit control, or choose items from the list box.
The style of the extended combo box, specified as one of the following Windows API constants:
The resource ID of the extended combo box.
member.remarks: CBS_AUTOHSCROLL CBS_DISABLENOSCROLL CBS_DROPDOWN CBS_DROPDOWNLIST CBS_HASSTRINGS CBS_LOWERCASE CBS_NOINTEGRALHEIGHT CBS_OEMCONVERT CBS_OWNERDRAWFIXED CBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE CBS_SIMPLE CBS_SORT CBS_UPPERCASE Consult your Microsoft Win32 Software Development Kit documentation for detailed information about a particular style constant.

(The list box appears only if the user selects the drop-down icon; if the user then selects the icon again, the list box is hidden.) This is the default.
BOXDROPDOWNLIST
Same as BOXDROPDOWN, except that the user can only choose items from the list box. Text cannot be entered or edited in the edit control.
BOXSIMPLE
A extended combo box with both an edit control and a list box that are visible at all times. The user can enter/edit text in the edit control, or choose items from the list box.
The style of the combo box, specified as one of the Windows API constants listed below:
The resource ID of the combo box.
member.remarks: CBS_AUTOHSCROLL CBS_DISABLENOSCROLL CBS_DROPDOWN CBS_DROPDOWNLIST CBS_HASSTRINGS CBS_LOWERCASE CBS_NOINTEGRALHEIGHT CBS_OEMCONVERT CBS_OWNERDRAWFIXED CBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE CBS_SIMPLE CBS_SORT CBS_UPPERCASE

member.name: M:VO.ConsoleCoord.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate a ConsoleCoord object.
member.param: An integer value specifying the x-axis position or width.
An integer value specifying the y-axis position or height.
member.remarks: ConsoleCoord:Init() instantiates a new ConsoleCoord object, which can be used for the Console:Size and Console:CursorPos properties.

member.name: M:VO.Console.Clear
member.summary: Clear the console window.
member.example:
This code snippet creates and clear a new console window:
FUNCTION Start() LOCAL oCon AS Console oCon := Console{} oCon:Clear()

member.name: M:VO.Console.Destroy
member.summary: Provide a method to de-instantiate a.
member.remarks: This method can be used when a Console object is no longer needed. Console:Destroy() de-instantiates the Console object, and allows you to close and free any resources that were opened or created by the object without waiting for the garbage collector.

member.name: M:VO.Console.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate a new Console object.
member.param: A logical value forcing the allocation of a new console window, if set to TRUE. The default is FALSE.
member.remarks: The Init() method allocates a new console window. By default, or if the <lNew> parameter is set to FALSE, X# first tries to use an already open console window, e.g., if the application was started from the command line. If this fails, or if <lNew> was set to TRUE, Console:Init() allocates and opens a new console window.
member.example:
This code snippet creates and clear a new console window:
FUNCTION Start() LOCAL oCon AS Console oCon := Console{} oCon:Clear()

member.name: M:VO.Console.Read
member.summary: Use this to read the console input buffer.
member.returns: A string containing the input characters.
member.remarks: The Console:Read() method reads up to 256 characters of console input buffer.
member.example:
The following lines wait for, read, and echo console input.
FUNCTION Start(p) LOCAL oCon AS Console LOCAL sInput AS STRING oCon := Console{} oCon:Clear() oCon:Write("Enter text: ") sInput := oCon:Read() oCon:Write("You entered : " + sInput)

member.name: M:VO.Console.Wait
member.summary: Waits for a key press or mouse click on the console window.
member.returns: A character representation of the key pressed or mouse button clicked. In general this return value should not be used.
member.remarks: This method waits for a key press or mouse click on the console.
member.example:
The following lines display the current date and then wait for a keypress
FUNCTION Start(p) LOCAL oCon AS Console LOCAL sInput AS STRING oCon := Console{} oCon:Clear() oCon:Write("The date: " + DTOC(TODAY()) oCon:WriteLine("Press any key to continue") sInput := oCon:Wait()

member.name: M:VO.Console.Write(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Write a string to the console window.
member.param: The string to be written to the console.
member.remarks: This method writes a string to the console. The string is written at the current cursor position.
member.example:
The following lines wait for, read, and echo console input.
FUNCTION Start(p) LOCAL oCon AS Console LOCAL sInput AS STRING oCon := Console{} oCon:Clear() oCon:Write("Enter text: ") sInput := oCon:Read() oCon:Write("You entered : " + sInput)

member.name: M:VO.Console.WriteLine(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Write a string to the console window and start a new line.
member.param: The string to be written to the console.

member.name: M:VO.Console.WriteError(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Write an error message string to the StdErr handle.
member.param: The string to be written to the StdErr handle.

member.name: M:VO.ControlWindow.Destroy
member.summary: Free memory resources allocated for a ControlWindow object and its derived objects.
member.remarks: This method immediately frees resources for ControlWindow objects created explicitly in your application. ControlWindow:Destroy() also takes care of resources allocated to derived classes and deallocates them in the necessary order.

member.name: M:VO.ControlWindow.Disable
member.summary: Disable a control window, including its associated control (until a subsequent call to ControlWindow:Enable()).
member.remarks: Disabled controls are not active (for example, push buttons cannot be clicked and data controls cannot be modified) and, therefore, they do not send events to their owner windows. Note that under Windows, a disabled control is dimmed.

member.name: M:VO.ControlWindow.Enable
member.summary: Enable a control window that was previously disabled.
member.remarks: Enabling a control window allows it to generate events and to send the events to its owner window when the user manipulates the control window. The dimming of disabled control windows is removed, and the control window is restored to its normal appearance. By default, control windows are enabled until disabled, so there is no need to call this Enable() method unless ControlWindow:Disable() was previously called.

member.name: M:VO.ControlWindow.Hide
member.summary: Hide a control window and its associated control so it is not visible (until a subsequent call to ControlWindow:Show()).

member.name: M:VO.ControlWindow.#ctor(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Construct a control window from an existing control.
member.param: The control that should be used to initialize the control window. It should be an instance of any subclass of Control.
member.remarks: The control used to initialize the control window is automatically destroyed when the control window is destroyed.
member.example:
The following example constructs a control window with the same properties as a push button:
CLASS PbWindow INHERIT ControlWindow METHOD Init(oWOwner,nResourceID) CLASS PbWindow LOCAL oPB AS OBJECT oPB := PushButton{oOwner,nResourceID} SUPER:Init(oPB)

member.name: M:VO.ControlWindow.SetFocus
member.summary: Pass input focus to a control window, thereby directing all mouse and keyboard input to its associated control.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Activate(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and a window is activated. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The event that describes which window was activated.
member.remarks:
The Activate() event occurs at the start of the control's lifetime or when the control is activated after it has been deactivated (for example, by clicking on it with the mouse). The newly active control receives the input focus.
You should create and show cursors (if needed) in this event handler method. Any subclass with its own Activate() and Deactivate() event handlers should always call its owner's handlers. This ensures that the caption bars get highlighted or dimmed accordingly.

member.name: M:VO.Control.AsString
member.summary: Return the contents of the control (or its identifying label).
member.remarks: For controls that have values, such as edit controls and check boxes, this method returns the same as Control:TextValue. For controls that do not have values, such as push buttons, it returns the same as Control:Caption. In either case, Control:AsString() presents the control as a recognizable string.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Deactivate(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and a window is deactivated. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: An empty event required to maintain the protocol that all event handlers have exactly one event as their argument.
member.remarks: This event handler is normally invoked when another application, window or control becomes activated.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Destroy
member.summary: Provide a method to de-instantiate any Control object.
member.remarks: This method can be used when a Control object is no longer needed. Control:Destroy() de-instantiates the Control object and allows you to close and free any resources that were opened or created by the object, without waiting for the garbage collector.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Disable
member.summary: Disable a control (until a subsequent call to Control:Enable()).
member.remarks: Disabled controls are not active (for example, push buttons cannot be clicked and data controls cannot be modified) and, therefore, they do not send events to their owner windows. Note that under Windows, a disabled control is dimmed.

member.name: M:VO.Control.DisableTheme
member.summary: Disable the WinXP theme for a control.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Dispatch(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide the prototype dispatcher for events within the system when the control has focus; routing various events to their appropriate event handlers. Important! This is a callback method used by X#.
member.param: The event to be handled.
member.returns: A numeric value representing the event handler to handle the event.
member.remarks:
Controls receive events from the user and the system all of the time. Each control receives only the events that are relevant to it. For each event that is generated, two things happen: 1. The event is converted to a particular Event object (an ExposeEvent or a MouseEvent, for example) according to the action that triggered the event. 2. The appropriate event handler is called, and this typed Event object is passed to it.
If you want to set a specific return value for the underlying window procedure, you have to change the EventReturnValue variable for the control object. If you want to handle other events (for example, timer events), you need to write your own Dispatch() method. The following guidelines should be followed when writing a customized Dispatch() method: 1. Subclass an event type appropriate to the type of operation for which it is being used. 2. Add an event handler function to your derived object. (This event handler should be called with the event when the event is received.) 3. In general, the implementation of this event handler should call Default(). This keeps the same behavior as the base class, but it also allows other classes to provide useful event handlers for your new type of event, allowing you to provide a framework for other classes to use. The base class Dispatch() method should be called in those cases where the received event is not handled by the customized dispatcher. For example: RETURN SUPER:Dispatch(<oEvent>)

member.name: M:VO.Control.Enable
member.summary: Enable a control that was previously disabled.
member.remarks: Enabling a control allows it to generate events and to send the events to its owner window when the user manipulates the control. The dimming of disabled controls is removed, and the control is restored to its normal appearance. By default, controls are enabled until disabled, so there is no need to call this Enable() method unless Control:Disable() was previously called.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Expose(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and whenever part of the window needs repainting. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The ExposeEvent object that describes which control of the window needs repainting.
member.remarks:
This is one of the most important event handlers. A control requires repainting when the control: Is partially uncovered by another window Is first shown Increases in size Is being restored after being iconized The control should retain enough information to redraw the screen as it was (or as it should be).
An ExposeEvent is also triggered by calling Repaint() or Update(); you should not call Repaint() or Update() during the Expose().

member.name: M:VO.Control.FocusChange(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and the input focus changes from the current control to another (or vice versa). Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The FocusChangeEvent object that identifies whether the focus is being gained or lost.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Handle(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Return the handle for a control.
member.param: The type of handle required. Zero (0) is the only supported option, and it is the default if <nHandleType> is omitted.
member.returns: A handle to the "window" (control), describing the underlying system object.
member.remarks: This method provides a handle to the window, which can then be used by Windows API calls.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Hide
member.summary: Hide a control so it is not visible (until a subsequent call to Control:Show()).

member.name: M:VO.Control.HorizontalScroll(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and a horizontal scroll bar is scrolled. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The ScrollEvent object that describes the scroll type and new position.
member.remarks: The default behavior for this event handler is to update the thumb position; this can be changed using your own implementation of the handler. This event handler only works for HorizontalScrollBar and WindowHorizontalScrollBar objects. If the application has vertical scroll bars, use a WindowVerticalScrollBar event handler.

member.name: M:VO.Control.#ctor(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Construct a control.
member.param: The window that owns the control.
The unique ID of the control (between 1 and 8000).
The origin of the control in canvas coordinates.
The dimension of the control in canvas coordinates.
String representing the control class (for example, 'Edit', 'ListBox', etc.)

Constant representing the style of the control, specified either by a X# style constant or a Windows API style constant. Styles can be combined using the _Or() operator.
Consult your Microsoft Win32 Software Development Kit documentation for detailed information about a particular Windows API constant.
Logical value indicating whether the control is data-aware (TRUE) or not (FALSE). The default is FALSE.
The resource ID of the control.
member.remarks: Controls are created in one of two ways: dynamically or from a compiled dialog resource. Dynamic creation, which requires that size and position be specified as instantiation parameters, can be used on any type of window. A compiled dialog resource (which specifies both size and location of the control) can be used only with data windows and dialog windows. Additionally, the default state when a control is created depends on the way you placed the control: With dynamic creation, the control remains invisible until you invoke Control:Show(). This allows the program to set up the control correctly (with the correct size, position, and any other parameters), while avoiding the "visual noise" of changing controls. With resource-bound instantiation, the control is automatically shown, without requiring a call to Control:Show().

member.name: M:VO.Control.IsVisible
member.summary: Report if this control is visible (completely or partially) or hidden.
member.returns: TRUE if the control is visible; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This style is set in the Windows Editor.

member.name: M:VO.Control.KeyDown(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and a key on the keyboard is pressed. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The KeyEvent object that describes what key was pressed.
member.remarks: This event handler is called only if the control has the input focus.

member.name: M:VO.Control.KeyUp(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and a key on the keyboard is released. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The KeyEvent object that describes what key was released.
member.remarks: This event handler is called only if the control has the input focus.

member.name: M:VO.Control.LinkDF(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Connect a control to a data field in a data server.
member.param: The server that the field is to be linked to. Ordinarily, this is the common server that the entire window is linked to, but it is possible to link individual fields to other servers.
The number of the data field within the server.
member.remarks: Control:LinkDF() should ordinarily not be called directly by the application. It is called by the DataWindow:Use() method; Use() connects an entire client to an entire server. You can use Control:LinkDF() to link a control to a data field explicitly, perhaps if the control's name doesn't match the data field's name so the automatic linkage of the Use() method doesn't work. It is even possible to use Control:LinkDF() to link individual controls to different servers; however, this is not recommended, because none of the automatic behavior of the data window and none of its cooperation with the data server applies to more than one server. Notifications are not to be received for servers other than the main server that the window is registered with, and actions such as DataWindow:Delete() and DataWindow:Append() apply to the main server. To link a window to more than one database, use the techniques described in the "GUI Classes" chapter of the Programmer's Guide.

member.name: M:VO.Control.MenuInit(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when a pop-up menu owned by the control is about to pop up.
member.param: The MenuInitEvent object that describes which menu is about to pop up.

member.name: M:VO.Control.MenuSelect(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when an item on a menu owned by the control is highlighted.
member.param: The MenuSelectEvent object that describes which menu and menu command (via the item's ID) generated the event.

member.name: M:VO.Control.MouseButtonDoubleClick(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus, the mouse pointer is positioned over the window, and a mouse button is double-clicked. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The MouseEvent object that contains information about the state of the mouse when the button was double-clicked.
member.remarks: MouseButtonDoubleClick() often occurs between MouseButtonDown() and MouseButtonUp() event handlers.

member.name: M:VO.Control.MouseButtonDown(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus, the mouse pointer is positioned over the window, and a mouse button is clicked. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The MouseEvent object that contains information about the state of the mouse when the button was clicked.

member.name: M:VO.Control.MouseButtonUp(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus, the mouse pointer is positioned over the window, and a mouse button is released. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The MouseEvent object that contains information about the state of the mouse when the button was released.
member.remarks: Do not assume Control:MouseButtonUp() is called immediately after Control:MouseButtonDown(). Other MouseEvents can be generated during this time. In some cases, there may be no Control:MouseButtonUp() events directed to the window for a corresponding Control:MouseButtonDown(). This can occur if the mouse button is clicked while over the window, but released after the mouse has moved off the window.

member.name: M:VO.Control.MouseDrag(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and a mouse with one or more buttons clicked is moved in the window. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The MouseEvent object containing information on the location and state of the buttons when the mouse was dragged.

member.name: M:VO.Control.MouseMove(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and the mouse is moved in the control. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The MouseEvent object containing information on the location of the mouse when it was moved.
member.remarks: This event occurs when the mouse is moved with no mouse buttons clicked.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Move(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and the control is moved (either by the user or by the application). Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The MoveEvent object that describes the window movement.

member.name: M:VO.Control.ParentNotify
member.summary: This method gets called from the Window:ControlNotify() methods for notifications that have not been processed.
member.returns: The return value of this method must be a LONG. A NON-ZERO value indicates that the event is handled by the control. When the event is NOT handled, VO will call the Window:Default() method to process the event.

remarks.note: This method is NOT implemented in the VO GUI Classes. If you want to use the algorithm you need to add the method to your control subclass.

member.name: M:VO.Control.PerformValidations
member.summary: Perform all the validations defined to this control's field specification (for example, required, maximum and minimum digits, maximum and minimum value, validation rule) and return the result of the test.
member.returns: If any of the validations fail, this method sets the status of the control appropriately and returns FALSE. Otherwise, it returns TRUE.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Resize(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and the control changes size. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The ResizeEvent object that describes the new dimensions of the control.
member.remarks: In the Control:Resize() event handler, calling Window:Size should be used with caution to avoid entering an infinite loop.

member.name: M:VO.Control.RestoreUpdate
member.summary: Resume all drawing updates for a control (after Control:SuspendUpdate() is called).
member.remarks: This method resumes all drawing updates for a control (after Control:SuspendUpdate() is called).

member.name: M:VO.Control.SetFocus
member.summary: Pass input focus to a control, thereby directing all mouse and keyboard input to the control.

member.name: M:VO.Control.SetStyle(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Set the style for the control.
member.param: The style of the control, specified by a either a X# style constant or a Windows API style constant.
TRUE enables the specified style; FALSE disables it. If omitted, the default is TRUE.

member.name: M:VO.Control.Show
member.summary: Display a control so it is visible.
member.remarks: The default state when a control is created depends on the way you placed the control: With dynamic creation, the control remains invisible until you invoke Control:Show(). This allows the program to set up the control correctly (with the correct size, position, and any other parameters), while avoiding the "visual noise" of changing controls. With resource-bound instantiation, the control is automatically shown, without requiring a call to Control:Show(). Control:Show() is also usually called to redisplay a control that was hidden with the Control:Hide() method.

member.name: M:VO.Control.SuspendUpdate
member.summary: Temporarily suspend all drawing updates for a control; drawing resumes with a call to Control:RestoreUpdate().
member.remarks: This method suspends all drawing updates for a control. It is especially useful for TreeView and ListView controls, where you typically want to suspend drawing while the ListView or TreeView control is filled.

member.name: M:VO.Control.VerticalScroll(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Provide a method that is invoked when the control has focus and a vertical scroll bar is scrolled. Important! This is a callback method used by X#. Normally, it should not be called in your application code.
member.param: The ScrollEvent object that describes the scroll type and new position.
member.remarks: The default behavior for this event handler is to update the thumb position; this can be changed using your own implementation of the handler. This event handler only works for HorizontalScrollBar and WindowHorizontalScrollBar objects. If the application has horizontal scroll bars, use a HorizontalScrollBar event handler.

member.name: M:VO.CPop.CheckReply
member.summary: Check the response from a POP server for error codes.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method checks the response string from the POP server for error codes, and sets the ReplyCode, ReplyString and Error properties.

member.name: M:VO.CPop.connect(XSharp.__Usual,XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Establish a connection to the remote POP server.
member.param: String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the POP server in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
Port number at <cHostNameOrIP>. If not specified, the connection will be established to port SELF:RemotePort. The default value is IPPORT_POP (110).
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method establishes a connection to the specified remote mail server at port <nPort> or SELF:RemotePort.

member.name: M:VO.CPop.DeleteMail(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Delete specified mail from a remote POP server.
member.param: The number of the e-mail message to be deleted from the queue.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method removes the specified e-mail message from a remote POP server.
member.example:
The following function collects all waiting e-mail messages and deletes them from the remote POP server:
FUNC POPGetMails (cServerIP AS STRING,; cUser AS STRING,; cPassW AS STRING,; lDelete AS LOGIC ) AS ARRAY ; PASCAL LOCAL oPop AS CPop LOCAL aRet AS ARRAY LOCAL i,n AS INT oPop := CPop{cServerIP} IF oPop:Logon(cUser, cPassW) oPop:GetStatus() n := oPop:MailCount aRet := oPop:ListMail() IF lDelete // Deleting all messages FOR i := 1 TO n oPop:DeleteMail(i) NEXT ENDIF ENDIF oPop:Disconnect() RETURN aRet

member.name: M:VO.CPop.Disconnect
member.summary: Shut down the current POP connection.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method can be used to close the connection to a POP3 Server.
member.example: See the CPop:DeleteMail() example.

member.name: M:VO.CPop.GetMail(XSharp.__Usual)
member.summary: Read specified mail from a remote POP server.
member.param: The number of the e-mail message to be read from the queue.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method reads the specified e-mail message from a remote POP server and decodes it into its MailHeader, MailBody, and Attachment parts.
member.example:
The following function reads the specified e-mail messages from a remote POP server:
FUNC POPReadMail (cServerIP AS STRING,; cUser AS STRING,; cPassW AS STRING,; nMail AS INT ) AS ARRAY ; PASCAL LOCAL oPop AS CPop LOCAL aRet AS ARRAY LOCAL n AS INT oPop := CPop{cServerIP} IF oPop:Logon(cUser, cPassW) oPop:GetStatus() n := oPop:MailCount IF nMail <= n IF oPop:GetMail(nMail) aRet := ArrayCreate(3) aRet[1] := oPop:MailHeader aRet[2] := oPop:MailBody aRet[3] := oPop:Attachment ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF oPop:Disconnect() RETURN aRet

member.name: M:VO.CPop.GetMailInfo
member.summary: Method to return an array of information regarding a particular email waiting on the server.
member.param: The number of the email being investigated
member.returns: ARRAY of strings representing the date, time, sender name and subject for that email. {cDate, cTime, cSender, cSubject}
member.remarks: This method consults the server and returns information about emails waiting to be downloaded. The user can then make decisions about which mails to download or delete.

member.name: M:VO.CPop.GetStatus
member.summary: Retrieve the mail status for the current active user from a remote POP server.
member.returns: A string containing the current status.
member.remarks: This method asks for the status for the current active user, who must be logged on, and saves the results to the MailHeader, MailCount, and TotalBytes properties.
member.example: See the CPop:DeleteMail() example.

The user ID.
The user's password.

member.name: M:VO.CPop.ListMailIDs

member.remarks: This method consults the server and returns a list of mail numbers and their corresponding ID. This information can be used to prevent duplicated downloads where headers are inspected or mails downloaded but not deleted from the server.

member.name: M:VO.CSmtp.CheckReply

member.example:
The following example checks the connection to Computer Associates mail server:
FUNC SmtpTest() LOCAL oSmtp AS CSMTP oSmtp := CSMTP{"ServerCheck", "", "", "Check "} oSmtp:Timeout := 1000 oSmtp:Connect("mail2.cai.com") oSmtp:CheckReply() ? oSmtp:ReplyString ? oSmtp:ReplyCode ? oSmtp:Error oSmtp:Disconnect()

member.name: M:VO.CSmtp.SendAttachedFile
member.summary: Send an attached file as part of an e-mail to a remote SMTP server.
member.param: The file, optionally including the drive letter and path, to be sent.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: SendAttachedFile() is called from the SendMail() method to encode and send the file specified by SELF:AttachmentFile to the remote SMTP Server.

member.name: M:VO.CSmtp.SendHeaderInfo
member.summary: Create a mail header and send it as part of an e-mail to a remote SMTP server.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: SendHeaderInfo() is called from the SendMail() method to prepare and send the appropriate header to the remote SMTP server. The method does not take any parameters. The values for the FROM, TO, CC and BCC are read from the Email property of the cSMTP class.

member.name: M:VO.CSmtp.SendMail
member.summary: Send a complete e-mail to a remote SMTP server.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method sends the complete e-mail to the remote SMTP Server. Based on the SELF:MailBody, SELF:AttachmentFile, SELF:DestList, SELF:CCList, SELF:FromAddress and SELF:RemoteHost values, the SendMail()method prepares all necessary data including header and control sequences, and calls the SELF:SendHeaderInfo(), SendMailBody() and SELF:SendAttachedFile() methods at different stages of that transaction.

member.name: M:VO.CSmtp.SendMailBody

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.accept
member.summary: Accept a new connection on a socket.
member.returns: A new CSocket object instance, if successful; otherwise, NULL_OBJECT.
member.remarks: This method can be used to make Internet server applications wait for a client's connection.
member.example:
The following example implements a simple socket server function listening for first connections at port 7:
FUNCTION ServerTest() LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL oSockMsg AS CSocket LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL cFrom AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT LOCAL lRet AS LOGIC oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:listen(1) lRet := .F. oSockMsg := oSocket:accept() IF oSockMsg != NULL_OBJECT cData := oSockMsg:GetLine() oSockMsg:getpeername(@cFrom, @nPort) ? "Connection accepted from ", cFrom, ; , client port: , NTrim(nPort) ? "Received data: ", cData lRet := .T. ENDIF oSockMsg:Close() ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN lRet

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.bind(System.UInt16,System.String,System.Int16)
member.summary: Associate a local address with a socket.
member.param: Port number at <cHostNameOrIP>.

String containing the local name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45). If NULL_STRING is specified, the local host name is assumed.
SHORTINT number specifying the Address Family. Valid values are:
AF_DATAKIT
AF_CCITT
AF_MAX
AF_SNA
AF_DECnet
AF_DLI
AF_LAT
AF_HYLINK

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.Close
member.summary: Disconnects the socket and closes it.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method disconnects a connection and then closes it. If a socket is not closed in code, it will be automatically closed if the appropriate object instance goes out of scope.
member.example: See the CSocket:Connect() example.

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.connect(System.String,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Establish a connection of the socket instance to a peer.
member.param: String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
Port number at <cHostNameOrIP>.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method establishes a connection to the specified remote address at port <nPort>.
member.example:
The following example checks whether a remote SMTP server is currently available:
FUNCTION Start IF CheckRemote("mail2.cai.com", IPPORT_SMTP, 1000) ? "CA's mail server is available" ELSE ? "Mail server currently not accessible" ENDIF FUNCTION CheckRemote (cServer AS STRING, nPort AS INT, ; nTimeout AS INT); AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL lRet AS LOGIC oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} oSocket:TimeOut := nTimeout lRet := oSocket:connect(cServer, nPort) oSocket:Close() RETURN lRet

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.DisConnect
member.summary: Shut down the current socket connection. This disables sending/receiving on the socket, but does NOT close the socket. Note that this function does NOT close the connection like it did in Visual Objects 2.5! To close a socket you need to call cSocket:Close()!
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: Disconnect() can be used to close the connection made for the CSocket object instance. If not specified, the connection will automatically be closed if the appropriate object instance goes out of scope.
member.example: See the CSocket:Connect() example.

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.DisplayError
member.summary: Display error messages.
member.remarks: Displays the error message.

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.GetLine
member.summary: Extract the first line from the socket data received via the current connection.
member.returns: String containing the received line of data, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING
member.remarks: This method extracts the first line from input data. GetLine() can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
member.example: See the CSocket:Accept() example.

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.GetLineFrom(System.String@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Wait for connection and extract first line from incoming data.
member.param: Reference to a string to receive the client's IP address.
Reference to a DWORD value to receive the client's port number.
member.returns: String containing the received line, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING
member.remarks: This method waits for data packages and extracts the first line from input data. Besides this, GetLineFrom() extracts the IP address and port number associated with the received Data. This method can be used by UDP sockets to retrieve datagram packages sent via the Internet.
member.example:
The following example implements a simple socket server function listening for the first datagram package at port 7:
FUNCTION ServerTest2() AS VOID PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL cFrom AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_DGRAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:TimeOut := 10000 cData := oSocket:GetLineFrom(@cFrom, @nPort) IF cFrom == NULL_STRING ? "Timeout expired, no data received :-(" ELSE ? "Data received from ", cFrom, ; , "Client port: ", NTrim(nPort) ? "Received data:" , cData ENDIF ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.getpeername(System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the address of the peer to which the socket is connected.
member.param: Reference to a string to receive the peer's IP address.
Reference to a DWORD value to receive the peer's port number.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.
member.remarks: This method gets the address and port number of the peer to which the socket is connected.
member.example: See the CSocket:Accept() example.

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.GetRaw
member.summary: Receive all available data from a socket.
member.returns: String containing the received data, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING.
member.remarks: This method stores input data to a string. GetRaw() can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
member.example:
The following example implements a simple socket server function waiting for connection at port 7 and receiving all data from the client:
FUNCTION ServerTest3() AS VOID PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL oSockMsg AS CSocket LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL cFrom AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:listen(1) oSockMsg := oSocket:accept() IF oSockMsg != NULL_OBJECT cData := oSockMsg:GetRaw() oSockMsg:GetPeerName(@cFrom, @nPort) ? "Data received from ", cFrom, ; ", Client port: ", NTrim(nPort) ? "Received data: ", cData ENDIF oSockMsg:Close() ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.GetRawText(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Receive all available data from a socket.
member.returns: String containing the received data, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING.
member.remarks: This method stores input data to a string. GetRaw() can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
member.example:
The following example implements a simple socket server function waiting for connection at port 7 and receiving all data from the client:
FUNCTION ServerTest3() AS VOID PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL oSockMsg AS CSocket LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL cFrom AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:listen(1) oSockMsg := oSocket:accept() IF oSockMsg != NULL_OBJECT cData := oSockMsg:GetRaw() oSockMsg:GetPeerName(@cFrom, @nPort) ? "Data received from ", cFrom, ; ", Client port: ", NTrim(nPort) ? "Received data: ", cData ENDIF oSockMsg:Close() ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.GetSockNname
member.summary: Get the local name for a socket.
member.param: Reference to a string which is to receive the peer's IP address.
Reference to a DWORD value to receive the peer's port number
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE
member.remarks: This method gets the local address and port number of the socket.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates the use of this method:
FUNCTION SimpleTest() AS VOID PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cIP AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:GetSockName(@cIP, @nPort) ? "Local IP ", cIP, ", port: ", NTrim(nPort) ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.SendLine(System.String)
member.summary: Send data terminated by CRLF to the connected socket.
member.param: Data to be sent via the socket.
member.returns: Number of data sent, if successful; otherwise, 0 (zero).
member.remarks: Method SendLine() sends a line to the connected socket. This method can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates this method:
FUNCTION ClientTest() AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cTo AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:connect( HostName(), 7) IF oSocket:SendLine("Hello world") > 0 oSocket:GetPeerName(@cTo, @nPort) ? "Data sent to ", cTo, ", port: ", NTrim(nPort) ENDIF oSocket:Close() ENDIF RETURN

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.SendLineTo(System.String,System.String,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Send data terminated by CRLF to a specific destination.
member.param: Data to be sent via the socket.
String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
Port number at <cHostNameOrIP>.
member.returns: Number of data sent, if successful; otherwise, 0 (zero).
member.remarks: This method sends a line to a destination without establishing a connection. SendLine() can be used for UDP sockets to send datagram packages via the Internet.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates the use of this method:
FUNCTION ClientTest1() AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cTo AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_DGRAM} IF oSocket:SendLineTo("Hello world", HostName(), 7) ? "Datagram package sent ... " ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

member.name: M:VO.CSocket.SendRaw(System.Void*,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Send any data to the connected socket.
member.param: Pointer to the data to be sent via the socket.
Length of the data to be sent.
member.returns: TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE
member.remarks: SendRaw() sends raw data to the connected socket. This method can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates the use of this method:
FUNCTION ClientTest2() AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cTo AS STRING LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL nSize AS INT LOCAL nPort AS INT CLS oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:connect( HostName(), 7) cData := MemoRead("Test.txt") nSize := SLen(cData) IF oSocket:SendRaw(PTR(_CAST, cData), nSize) oSocket:GetPeerName(@cTo, @nPort) ? "Data sent to ", cTo, ", port: ", ; NTrim(nPort) ENDIF ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

member.remarks: SendRaw() sends raw data to the connected socket. This method can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates the use of this method:
FUNCTION ClientTest2() AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cTo AS STRING LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL nSize AS INT LOCAL nPort AS INT CLS oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:connect( HostName(), 7) cData := MemoRead("Test.txt") nSize := SLen(cData) IF oSocket:SendRaw(PTR(_CAST, cData), nSize) oSocket:GetPeerName(@cTo, @nPort) ? "Data sent to ", cTo, ", port: ", ; NTrim(nPort) ENDIF ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

member.name: M:VO.CStorage.AttachmentAdd(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This method is called when an email is received to initialize the saving of a new attachment. The implementation in CStorage generates a unique ID and creates the (empty) file.
member.param: Contains the file name of the attachment.

The Coding type. Can be one of the following values:
CODING_TYPE_7BIT
CODING_TYPE_8BIT
CODING_TYPE_BASE64
CODING_TYPE_NONE
CODING_TYPE_PRINTABLE
CODING_TYPE_UNKNOWN
CODING_TYPE_UUENCODE
In most cases it is CODING_TYPE_BASE64 and only this type is implemented in the CStorage class.
member.returns: <cID> STRING The unique ID. If AttachmentAdd() fails it returns a NULL_STRING.
